Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a large ribbed red/brown pottery vessel, the fabric is black in section, interior slightly grooved, exterior worn in places with two parallel lines of cord-marked decoration and with remains of at least ten lines of Coptic text written in black ink beneath, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.87)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87588) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87588)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 89 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
